Package demos

Class GenericArrays

  • java.lang.Object
    • demos.GenericArrays
  • public class GenericArrays
extends java.lang.Object

    In Java, one cannot create raw arrays of generics. It is necessary to create Object arrays and perform careful castings in our various methods. GenericArrays demonstrates how to do this. This class is a simple wrapper over an array of LinkedList instances which contain Strings. You can see that ugly castings are necessary to avoid errors at compile or even run-time.

    Author:
    Jason Filippou
    See Also:
    ClassCastException

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericArrays

        public GenericArrays​(int sz)
        Constructor initializes this with the provided size. Observe the upcasting which happens in the code. Upcasting is ALWAYS ok in Java and any object-oriented programming language.
        Parameters:
        sz - the initial size of the underlying array.

      • insertIntoList

        public void insertIntoList​(int pos,
                           java.lang.String... elements)
        Insert a collection of Strings into the provided position of this

        pos - The position of the array to insert elements into.

      • getStrings

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStrings​(int pos)
        Get all the Strings stored at position pos.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the array to retrieve the list of Strings from.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList containing all the Strings in position pos. If there are no Strings stored at that position, the LinkedList returned is empty.
